description: From Old French destaindre (Modern French déteindre, Spanish desteñir). At some point possibly reanalysed as de-/dis- + stain (which is etymologically unrelated).

verbs.description: destain (third-person singular simple present destains, present participle destaining, simple past and past participle destained)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove a chemical stain from.
